free.question: I speak without a mouth and hear without ears. I have no body, but I come alive with wind. What am I?
What has keys but can't open locks?
free.hint: You press its keys to make music.

free.question: What can travel around the world while staying in a corner?
free.hint: You stick it to an envelope.

free.question: What has hands but cannot clap?
What has a head and a tail but no body?
free.hint: You flip it to choose between two options.

free.question: What gets wetter as it dries?
free.hint: You use it after a shower.

free.question: I’m tall when I’m young and short when I’m old. What am I?
free.hint: You light me and I melt.

free.question: What month has 28 days?
free.hint: Think broadly — every month has at least 28 days.

free.question: What has one eye but cannot see?
What can you catch but not throw?
What has many teeth but cannot bite?
What building has the most stories?
What goes up but never comes down?
What begins with T, ends with T, and has T in it?
I have branches but no fruit, trunk or leaves. What am I?
What can you break, even if you never pick it up or touch it?
I’m light as a feather, yet the strongest person can’t hold me for five minutes. What am I?
free.hint: You take me in and let me out.

free.question: What runs but never walks, has a mouth but never talks?
What has legs but doesn't walk?
What word is spelled incorrectly in every dictionary?
What invention lets you look right through a wall?
I have a neck but no head. What am I?
What goes up and down but never moves?
What has a thumb and four fingers but is not alive?
What has a heart that doesn't beat?
What can be cracked, made, told, and played?
What has a ring but no finger?
What kind of room has no doors or windows?
What gets sharper the more you use it?
What begins with an E but only has one letter?
I go all around the world but always stay in a corner. What am I?
What sits in the corner but travels around the world?
What tastes better than it smells?
What has an eye but can't see and is often used in gardens?
What gets bigger when more is taken away?
What can fill a room but takes up no space?
What has four wheels and flies?
free.hint: It’s full of refuse and drivers joke it flies.

free.question: What kind of tree can you carry in your hand?
What begins with P, ends with E and has thousands of letters?
What has to be broken before you can use it?
What belongs to you but others use it more than you do?
What is full of holes but still holds water?
I have cities but no houses, forests but no trees, and rivers but no water. What am I?
What can you keep after giving it to someone?
The more of this there is, the less you see. What is it?
What runs all around a backyard, yet never moves?
What has one head, one foot and four legs?
What kind of coat is always wet when you put it on?

vip.question: Two in a corner, one in a room, zero in a house, but one in a shelter — what is it?
vip.hint: Look at the letters in each word.

vip.question: What can you hold in your left hand but not in your right?
I have keys but no locks. I have space but no room. You can enter but can't go outside. What am I?
What goes through towns and over hills but never moves?
I start out tall, but the longer I stand, the shorter I grow. What am I?
What can you break without touching it?
I have lakes with no water, mountains with no stone, and cities without buildings. What am I?
If you have me, you want to share me. If you share me, you don't have me. What am I?
What is so fragile that saying its name breaks it?
vip.hint: A single word can shatter it.

vip.question: I’m often running yet I have no legs. You need me but I don't need you. What am I?
What has cities but no houses?
What begins with an "e" and only contains one letter?
Feed me and I live, give me a drink and I die. What am I?
You see me once in June, twice in November, and not at all in May. What am I?
What can never be put in a saucepan?
What’s full of holes but still holds a lot of weight?
I have roads but no cars, forests but no trees. What am I?
The more you take, the more you leave behind. What are they?
What is always coming, but never arrives?
What goes up and down the stairs without moving?
A box without hinges, key, or lid, yet golden treasure inside is hid. What is it?
What kind of band never plays music?
I have a hole in my top; I am filled from the bottom. What am I?
vip.answer: a bathtub with a drain plug removed

vip.question: What has a bottom at the top?
Which word in the dictionary is spelled incorrectly?
What flattens all mountains, wipes out all species, destroy every building, and turns everything into pieces?
What English word has three consecutive double letters?
I have a neck but no head, two arms but no hands. What am I?
What is full of keys but can't open any doors?
Which creature walks on four legs in the morning, two at noon and three in the evening?
I have seas but no water, coasts but no sand. What am I?
What runs forever, but never moves?
vip.hint: Hands move but it stays in place.

vip.question: My life can be measured in hours, I serve by being devoured. Thin, I am quick; fat, I am slow. What am I?
vip.hint: The more you burn, the shorter I get.

vip.question: What can point in every direction but can't reach the destination by itself?
You can drop me from the tallest building and I'll be fine, but if you drop me in water I die. What am I?
What has four wheels and flies?
vip.hint: A pun — flies as in insects.

vip.question: What gets wetter as it dries?
If you throw a red stone into the blue sea what will it become?
What has a spine but no bones?
What building is the tallest in the world?
What can't talk but will reply when spoken to?
What goes up but never goes down?
What has a head, a tail, is brown, and has no legs?
What is light as a feather, yet the strongest person can't hold it for more than a few minutes?
What invention lets you see through walls?

premium.question: I am taken from a mine and shut up in a wooden case, from which I am never released, and yet I am used by almost every person. What am I?
I build up castles; I tear down mountains. I make some men blind; I help others to see. What am I?
I have no mouth, no arms, no legs, but I move stones. What am I?
The person who makes it, sells it. The person who buys it never uses it. The person who uses it never knows they're using it. What is it?
premium.hint: Used at the end of life.

premium.question: Alive without breath, as cold as death; never thirsty, ever drinking, all in mail never clinking. What am I?
I speak in tongues I don't know, I fall from the sky and you don't see me grow. What am I?
Forward I am heavy, backward I am not. What am I?
You measure my life in hours and I serve you by expiring. I die when you light me and I come alive when you feed me. What am I?
I am not alive, but I grow; I don't have lungs, but I need air; I don't have a mouth, but water kills me. What am I?
What is seen in the middle of March and April that can't be seen at the beginning or end of either month?
I am always hungry, I must always be fed, the finger I touch will soon turn red. What am I?
Remove my first letter and I still sound the same. Remove my last letter and I still sound the same. Even remove my middle letter and I will still sound the same. What am I?
I have cities but no houses, forests but no trees, and rivers without water. What am I?
I can be cracked, made, told, and played. What am I?
What can bring back the dead; make us cry, make us laugh, make us young; is born in an instant, yet lasts a lifetime?
I am always in front of you but can never be seen. What am I?
I turn once, what is out will not get in. I turn again, what is in will not get out. What am I?
I have keys but no locks. I have space but no room. You can enter, but you can't leave. What am I?
What can't be used until it's broken?
The more you take, the more you leave behind. What are they?
I am always hungry and will die if not fed, but if you give me water I will die. What am I?
What can travel the world while staying in a corner?
I am the beginning of the end, the end of time and space; the beginning of every end, and the end of every place. What am I?
I have lakes with no water, mountains with no stone and cities with no buildings. What am I?
What has an eye but cannot see, is often served in a slice?
premium.hint: Also a storm 'eye' — trick question on two meanings.

premium.question: What is harder to catch the faster you run?
premium.hint: The more you exert, the harder it gets.

premium.question: Where does today come before yesterday?
I am always hungry, I eat everything in my path yet I leave just ash and sometimes treasure. What am I?
I can fly without wings. I cry without eyes. Wherever I go darkness follows me. What am I?
I am a box that holds keys without locks, yet they can unlock your future. What am I?
What has roots as nobody sees, is taller than trees. Up, up it goes, and yet never grows?
I have a tongue but cannot taste, eyes but cannot see, and a soul that never dies. What am I?
premium.hint: You wear me on your feet.

premium.question: You see a boat filled with people. It has not sunk, but when you look again you don't see a single person on the boat. Why?
What breaks and never falls, and what falls and never breaks?
What goes up but never comes down?
premium.hint: Repeated but used for premium difficulty.

premium.question: I have towns but no houses, lakes but no water, and forests but no trees. What am I?
What is bought by the yard but worn by the foot?
What gets bigger the more you take away?
I can be long or short; I can be grown or bought; I can be painted or left bare. What am I?
premium.hint: Fingers and construction both use them.

premium.question: I’m always in front of you but can never be seen. What am I?
What has no beginning, end, or middle?
People buy me to eat, but never eat me. What am I?
What has words but never speaks?
What can run but never walks, has a bed but never sleeps?
I have two hands, but I cannot clap. What am I?
What's the end of a circle?
I have holes but I can still hold water. What am I?

saturday.question: A man leaves home running. He turns left three times and returns home running. Suddenly two masked men grab him. Who are the masked men?
I am always hungry, I must always be fed. The finger I touch will soon turn red. What am I?
saturday.hint: A repeated theme, used here for Saturday difficulty.

saturday.question: I have cities but no houses, mountains but no trees, and water but no fish. What am I?
The more you have of me the less you see. What am I?
I am not alive but grow; I don't have lungs but need air; I don't have a mouth but need water to live. What am I?
I speak without a mouth, and hear without ears. I have nobody, but I come alive with wind. What am I?
saturday.hint: A classic used at highest difficulty peaks.

saturday.question: What disappears as soon as you say its name?
I am the beginning of eternity, the end of time and space, the beginning of every end, and the end of every place. What am I?
I can bring back the dead, make us cry, make us laugh, make us young. What am I?

question.question: I have keys but open no locks. I have space but no rooms. You can enter but can't go outside. What am I?
